body.head.byline: By VIVIAN S. TOY; With Elsa Brenner, Valerie Cotsalas, Suzanne Hamlin and C. J. Hughes

block.p: Dutch Colonial $579,000
SUFFOLK: 125 Southdown Road, Huntington

An updated 1930 Dutch colonial with two bedrooms and two baths on a 0.78-acre lot with attractive updates, including Brazilian cherry wood floors, wide moldings and a kitchen outfitted with granite counters and cherry cabinets. The formal dining room has sliding glass doors to a wooden deck.Kim Como, Daniel Gale Sotheby's International (516) 314-5984; www.danielgale.com
TAXES: $6,199 a year
PROS: The house is a short drive from the shops and restaurants in the downtown's vibrant Main Street. Its buyers would have access to a community beach.
CONS: There is a busy road out front.
Expanded Ranch $1,549,000
WESTCHESTER: 15 Meadow Road, Scarsdale

A five-bedroom, four-bath 1950s ranch, situated on almost three-fourths of an acre, that has been enlarged over the years. Iris S. Kalt, Prudential Centennial/Nestfinders (914) 643-1367; www.prucent.com
TAXES: $31,406 a year

PROS: The house has an open floor plan conducive to entertaining, and extras include skylights, two fireplaces, a music room, a sauna, guest quarters, a large finished basement with office and playroom, and a double lot with room for a pool.
CONS: The kitchen could use updating.
Bay Ridge Co-op $635,000
BROOKLYN: 149 Marine Avenue (at 96th Street), #6BC

A three-bedroom, two-bath sixth-floor unit in a pet-friendly postwar building, with an open living space and three exposures. David Marangio (718) 780-8155, Joseph Vassallo (718) 780-8104, Prudential Douglas Elliman; www.elliman.com. Open house Sunday, 12 to 2 p.m.
MAINTENANCE: $1,019 a month
PROS: Combined from two units, this apartment has a large common space, a laundry room and spectacular views of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge.
CONS: The third bedroom has no built-in closet.
Upper West Side Co-op $599,000
MANHATTAN: 380 Riverside Drive (at 110th Street), #7N
A one-bedroom, one-bath unit in a prewar doorman building. Brian Lewis, Halstead Property (212) 381-2252; www.halstead.com
MAINTENANCE: $697 a month

PROS: The bedroom sits on a corner and has windows that face north and west, providing great light and cross ventilation. The open kitchen-and-living-room combination is very inviting. The kitchen was recently renovated and has a professional grade stove and vent.
CONS: The living room windows overlook an interior courtyard.
Spuyten Duyvil Co-op $925,000
BRONX: 2501 Palisade Avenue, #G1
A two-bedroom, two-bath unit with washer/dryer, limestone fireplace and 11 closets. Linda Justus, Robert E. Hill (718) 884-2200, ext. 12; www.robertehill.com
MAINTENANCE: $1,051.96 a month

PROS: This apartment in the Villa Charlotte Brontë, built in 1926 on a cliff overlooking the Hudson River, has a secluded yet dramatic setting. Oak floors, casement windows and central air complement the views across to the Palisades.
CONS: The master bath is cramped. The rumble of trains is audible when the terrace doors are open.
